text: Henry Dearborn (February 23, 1751 â€“ June 6, 1829) was an American physician, and statesman. He was a veteran of both the American Revolutionary War and the War of 1812. He represented this district as a Democratic-Republican in the Third and Fourth Congresses (1793-1797). In 1801, President Thomas Jefferson appointed him Secretary of War, a post he held for eight years until March 7, 1809. == Legacy == In 1803, Lewis and Clark named the Dearborn River in west- central Montana after Dearborn. Dearborn County, Indiana, Dearborn, Michigan and Dearborn, Missouri were also named for him, as was Fort Dearborn in Chicago, Illinois. His son, Henry A. S. Dearborn, was a Congressman in 1831-1833.
